feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:54PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VALDEZ GLACIER DAMMED LAKE RELEASING... Valdez Glacier Dammed Lake on the Valdez Glacier is releasing causing rises on the Valdez Glacier Lake and Stream. The Valdez Glacier Stream is currently at 20.3 ft and has risen over 3 ft since Monday morning. The event is mirroring the release a year ago and is expected to rise an additional 2-3 ft to around 22.5 ft

entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL CHILTON COUNTY... At 531 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jemison, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:42PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then Increasing Winds This Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a chance of cities such as Reno (15%) and Fallon (50%) of hitting 100 degrees on Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:18AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ... URBAN/POOR DRAINAGE FLOODING POSSIBLE FOR PROVIDENCE AREA ... Heavy downpours continue to produce a threat for urban and poor drainage flooding in the Providence area for the next hour. Ponding on roads may lead to hydroplaning and hazardous travel conditions. Drive with caution. If heavy downpours continue to train over the same area, a flash flood warning may be needed.

entry.summary: ...Be Alert for Patchy Dense Fog During the Morning Commute... Moist ground and light or calm wind have allowed for patchy dense fog to develop early this morning, especially in river and mountain valleys. Visibility of 1/2 mile or less has been noted at locations within the Greenbrier Valley, the New River Valley, and along and near the Interstate 77 corridor, including Lewisburg WV,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alleghany; Botetourt; Carroll; Craig; Giles; Montgomery; Pulaski; Rockbridge; Wythe

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 1:50PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Recent rains and mountain snowmelt have resulted in rises along the Yakima River. This has resulted in minor flooding in some areas along the river. * WHERE...A small portion of Kittitas County northwest of Cle Elum. Specifically the Elk Meadows subdivision along the Yakima River.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 07 at 1:29PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN RISES ON RIVERS AND SMALL STREAMS IN THE CASCADES LATE THIS WEEK INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... An atmospheric river arrives on Thursday into the weekend bringing periods of moderate rainfall and warm, windy conditions. Rain amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible along the Cascade crest. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:57AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG THIS MORNING... Foggy conditions will continue through dawn for portions of northwest Pennslyvania and eastern Ohio. Visibilities will occasionally drop to a quarter mile or less, especially in valleys and low lying areas. Motorists should use caution and be prepared to slow down if they encounter fog.
